prompts.name: Generate Commit Message (Conventional Commits)
prompts.description: Generate git commit message following Conventional Commits specification
prompts.content:
Requirements:
- Use the specification at www.conventionalcommits.org
- Avoid overly verbose descriptions or unnecessary details
- Ensure the a line has no more than 100 characters
- Make use of fix:, feat:, build:, chore:, ci:, docs:, style:, refactor:, perf:, test:
- fix: and feat: are only to be used, when something changes for the end-user, not for code optimizations.
- Do not write what has changed in the code try to describe why the change was made (impact), if applicable.
- Add a footer note `Refs: <issue-number>`. Obtain the issue-number from the branch name. It is often after `fix/` or `/feature` with the format `<project>-<number>`(e.g. CL-123). Branch name: `$GIT_BRANCH_NAME`
- If there is no issue number in the branch name omit that footer note
  
Example:
```
fix: prevent racing of requests
  
Introduce a request id and a reference to latest request. Dismiss
incoming responses other than from latest request.
  
Remove timeouts which were used to mitigate the racing issue but are
obsolete now.
```
  
Comply with the following regex: ^((build|chore|ci|docs|feat|fix|perf|refactor|revert|style|test)(\([\w-]+\))?(!)?: ([^A-Z. ]|[^A-Z].*[^. ])|Merge( remote-tracking)? branch.+)$

prompts.name: Write Java Documentation
prompts.content:
Write JavaDoc comments for the provided Java code. Requirements: - Follow the Google Java Style Guide for Javadoc formatting and punctuation. - Do not include @author, @version, or @since tags. - Do not add example usage code. - Keep descriptions concise and clear. - Use proper HTML tags such as

,

    , and
  • where appropriate. - Document all public classes, methods, constructors, parameters, and return values. - For deprecated elements, include an @deprecated tag with a short explanation and recommended alternative. - Ensure parameter and return descriptions are full sentences starting with a capital letter and ending with a period. - Do not document private fields unless they are constants that require clarification. - Ensure a maximum of 100 characters per line

prompts.name: Generate Java Unit Tests
prompts.description: Create JUnit unit tests for Java code
prompts.content:
Java Test Generation - Best Practices

Generiere qualitativ hochwertige Java-Tests nach folgenden Richtlinien:

Grundprinzipien
- Keine Zufallswerte: Keine Random, UUID.randomUUID(), System.currentTimeMillis()
- Feste Testdaten: Fixierte IDs (1L, 2L), Namen ("John Doe"), Timestamps
- Deterministisch: Tests müssen wiederholbar sein
- PMD & Google Checkstyle konform
- JUnit 5 + AssertJ für Assertions
- Given-When-Then Struktur

 Testtypen

 Unit Tests (Standard)
Für: Business-Logik, Services, Mapper, Utilities
- `@ExtendWith(MockitoExtension.class)`
- `@Mock` für Dependencies
- `@InjectMocks` für Test-Objekt
- Mockito für Verhalten

 Integrationstests
Für: REST APIs, externe Clients, komplexe DB-Queries
- `@SpringBootTest` + `@AutoConfigureMockMvc` für Controller
- `MockWebServer` für externe API Clients
- `@MockBean` für Service-Layer

 Transaktionale Tests
Für: Datenbank-Tests mit `@Transactional` (Spring)

 Code-Qualität
- Google Java Style Guide
- Max. 100 Zeichen pro Zeile
- Aussagekräftige Testnamen: `shouldReturnUser_whenUserExists()`
- Vollständige Imports und Annotationen

 Verboten
Random-Werte, UUID.randomUUID(), now() ohne Mock
Test-Abhängigkeiten untereinander
@Disabled ohne Begründung

prompts.name: Generate kotlin Unit Tests
prompts.description: Create JUnit unit tests for kotlin code
prompts.content:
Kotlin Test Generation - Best Practices

Generiere qualitativ hochwertige Kotlin-Tests nach folgenden Richtlinien:

 Grundprinzipien
- Keine Zufallswerte: Keine Random, UUID.randomUUID(), System.currentTimeMillis()
- Feste Testdaten: Fixierte IDs (1L, 2L), Namen ("John Doe"), Timestamps
- Deterministisch: Tests müssen wiederholbar sein
- ktlint konform
- JUnit 5 + AssertJ oder Kotest
- Given-When-Then Struktur
- Backtick-Testnamen für Lesbarkeit

 Testtypen

 Unit Tests (Standard)
Für: Business-Logik, Services, Mapper, Utilities
- MockK bevorzugt (idiomatischer als Mockito)
- `@MockK` für Dependencies
- `@InjectMocks` für Test-Objekt
- Backtick-Namen: `` `should return user when user exists` ``

 Integrationstests
Für: REST APIs, externe Clients, komplexe DB-Queries
- `@SpringBootTest` + `@AutoConfigureMockMvc` für Controller
- `MockWebServer` für externe API Clients
- `@MockBean` für Service-Layer

 Transaktionale Tests
Für: Datenbank-Tests mit `@Transactional` (Spring)

 Kotlin-Spezifisches
- Data Classes für Testdaten
- Named Arguments für Klarheit
- MockK statt Mockito
- Kotest als JUnit-Alternative möglich
- Keine `!!` (null assertion) - sichere Alternativen nutzen

 Code-Qualität
- ktlint Style Guide
- Max. 120 Zeichen pro Zeile
- Aussagekräftige Backtick-Testnamen
- Vollständige Imports

 Verboten
Random-Werte, UUID.randomUUID(), now() ohne Mock
Test-Abhängigkeiten untereinander
@Disabled ohne Begründung
Null assertions (`!!`) in Tests
